answers.answer:
Cookies are small files, consisting of letters and numbers, stored on a user's device by a website through their browser. They facilitate personalized services and improve browsing by allowing the website to recognize the browser and store information.

To find more detailed information, visit the website and look for the "What is a cookie?" section within the privacy or cookie policy.

To find more detailed information, visit the website and look for the "What is a cookie?" section within the privacy or cookie policy. For more details, visit https://dopomoha.ro/en/cookie-policy

answers.answer:
Different types of cookies mentioned include session cookies, persistent cookies (which encompass third-party cookies), and cookies used for visitor analysis.

You can find detailed information on these types by reading the sections titled "Session cookies", "Persistent Cookies", "What are cookies placed by third parties?", and "How are cookies used by this website?" (specifically "Cookies for visitor analysis") within the provided text.

answers.answer:
Cookies enhance the internet browsing experience by personalizing settings and tailoring services to user needs and interests. They also make websites and online advertising more effective, facilitate embedding of multimedia content, and connect users to specific websites for a smoother return visit.

You can find this information under the section "What are the advantages of cookies?" in the provided text.

answers.answer:
Cookies can be session-based, lasting only until the user closes their browser, or persistent/permanent, which are stored for a predetermined length of time or until the user deletes them.

You can find detailed information on cookie lifespans by going to the website and reading under the sections "Session cookies," "Persistent Cookies," and "What is the lifespan of a cookie?".

answers.answer:
Websites generally use cookies to provide a better and more personalized browsing experience, tailoring services to user needs and interests by facilitating access, remembering settings, and making online advertising more effective. They help operators make websites more efficient and easier for users to access.

To find more detailed information, go to the website and read under the sections "What is a cookie?", "What are the advantages of cookies?", and "Why are cookies important to the Internet?".

answers.answer:
Cookies store information in small text files that allow a website to recognize a browser, remember personalized settings (like language or currency), and track browsing preferences or history to improve user experience. They do not store personal identifying information or contain malicious software.

You can find detailed information under the section "What type of information is stored and accessed through cookies?" on the provided privacy policy page.

They also make websites more effective and easier to access.

To find detailed information, go to the website and read under the section titled "Why are cookies important to the Internet?".

answers.answer:
Cookies can pose privacy risks by tracking user preferences and browsing history across multiple sites, potentially acting as spyware. They also present security risks if intercepted over unencrypted networks or if server misconfigurations allow attackers to gain unauthorized access.

To find detailed information, go to the website and read under the sections "Security and privacy issues" and "Other security aspects related to cookies."

answers.answer:
To browse safely with cookies, customize your browser's cookie settings to reflect your comfort level, especially if sharing a computer, and always install and update antispyware applications and your browser.

You can find detailed information on safe browsing tips in the original document under the section titled "Tips for safe and responsible browsing, based on cookies."

answers.answer:
Users can manage or stop cookies by changing the settings in their browser's "options" or "preferences" menu, which allows them to accept or reject cookies. For settings related to third-party cookies and online advertising privacy, an external website is also provided.

To find more detailed information, go to the website (https://dopomoha.ro/en/cookie-policy) and read under the section "How can I stop cookies?".

answers.answer:
Third-party cookies are a type of persistent cookie placed by a different website than the one the user is currently visiting, used anonymously to track interests for relevant advertising. They differ from other cookies as they originate from a domain separate from the website being viewed, unlike session cookies which are temporary, or first-party cookies placed by the visited site.

To find detailed information about third-party cookies and their differences, you can visit the provided website and read under the sections titled 'Persistent Cookies' and 'What are cookies placed by third parties?'.

answers.answer:
Cookies make online advertising more effective by tracking user interests, particularly through third-party cookies, which allows for the delivery of more relevant ads. Rejecting or disabling cookies will not stop online advertising, but it will prevent ads from being tailored to your preferences and interests.

You can find this information under the sections "What is a cookie?", "Persistent Cookies", and "Rejecting or disabling cookies" in the provided text.

answers.answer:
Rejecting or disabling cookies may make some websites unusable, impractical, or difficult to visit and use, potentially preventing access to popular sites like YouTube or Gmail. While it won't stop online advertising, these ads will no longer be tailored to your preferences and interests.

You can find this detailed information in the "Why are cookies important to the Internet?" and "How can I stop cookies?" sections of the provided privacy policy.
